Class ChatBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client
      • ChatBot
  • public class ChatBot
extends Client
    This class represents a type of client, a ChatBot.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> botResponses
      Hashmap with a String representing the prompt as a key and a list of Strings representing responses for the given prompt.
      (package private) java.util.Random rand
      Random which is used to generate random numbers to pick the bot response's randomly from the list of responses.

        serverIn, serverOut, socket

    • Field Detail

      • botResponses

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> botResponses
        Hashmap with a String representing the prompt as a key and a list of Strings representing responses for the given prompt.

      • rand

        java.util.Random rand
        Random which is used to generate random numbers to pick the bot response's randomly from the list of responses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatBot

        public ChatBot​(java.lang.String consoleAddress,
               java.lang.String consolePort)
        The constructor initialises userInput, socket (after validation), serverIn and serverOut. It then sends the server a message informing it which type of client it is and initialises the bot responses.
        Parameters:
        consoleAddress - String representing the address entered into the console (default is "localhost" if none was entered)
        consolePort - String representing the port number entered into the console (default is "14001" if none was entered)

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method, creates an instance of ChatBot using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
        Parameters:
        args - arguments received from commandline

      • go

        public void go()
        Implementation of the abstract method which is how the ChatBot should run. It runs the main loop which deals with reading from and writing to the server, and once the main loop is broken from, the BufferedReaders are closed and then the socket is closed.
        Specified by:
        go in class Client

      • mainLoop

        private void mainLoop()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Keeps reading the data received from the server, and replying to the server with a random response from a predetermined list of responses if a key word is contained in the data received. This only stops if an IOException is thrown (if the server is forcibly closed) or if the serverMsg is null, which occurs if the server closed peacefully.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server is closed forcibly

      • botResponse

        private void botResponse​(java.lang.String serverMsg)
        Searches for key words in the serverMsg. If one is found, then a random response (from a predetermined list of responses) is sent back to the server.
        Parameters:
        serverMsg - String containing the data received from the server

      • clientType

        public SenderType clientType()
        Implementation of the abstract method which returns the client type.
        Specified by:
        clientType in class Client
        Returns:
        senderType senderType.chatBot which represents the type of the client is ChatBot

      • initialiseBotResponses

        public void initialiseBotResponses()
        Initialises the botResponses HashMap

      • randomReply

        public java.lang.String randomReply​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list)
        Picks a random String from a given list of Strings
        Parameters:
        list - Arraylist of Strings representing the list of replies the bot should randomly choose from
        Returns:
        String being the chosen reply the bot should send the server
